summary: I am a second year PhD Candidate in Molecular Engineering at the University of Chicago. With a desire to innovate in the biotechnology field, I am using my previous research work in autoimmunity/HIV and industry experience characterizing ADCs for cancer therapeutics at Pfizer (formerly Seagen) to discover new adjuvants for improving vaccines.

currentPositions.companyName: Pritzker School of Molecular Engineering at the University of Chicago
currentPositions.description:
Advisor: Aaron Esser-Kahn 

-Adjuvant discovery via high throughput screening
currentPositions.title: Immunoengineering PhD Candidate

headline: Immunoengineer | Forbes Under 30 Scholar | PME Scholars Fellow | PhD Candidate

organizations.name: Society of Hispanic Professional Engineers
organizations.description: SHPE changes lives by empowering the Hispanic community to realize its fullest potential and to impact the world through STEM awareness, access, support and development.

organizations.name: Rice Firsts
organizations.description: Rice Firsts is a peer based mentoring program for incoming first generation students. By pairing them with peer mentor who is also among the first in their family to attend college, Rice Firsts aims to provide a personalized resource to the first year students in the form of a mentor who is familiar with the first generation student experience.  Mentors will serve as guides throughout a mentee’s first year at Rice, providing important insight into how to successfully make the academic, social, and interpersonal transition to college.

organizations.name: Rice Biomedical Engineering Society
organizations.description: The Rice Biomedical Engineering Society(BMES) is a professional, academic and social club that is made up of students interested in biomedical engineering. We seek to provide guidance and information to incoming bioengineering students and build the biomedical engineering community here at Rice University and the Houston area. The club attempts to connect members to bioengineers across the nation working in industry, in medicine, and in academia.

organizations.name: National Honor Society
organizations.description: National Honor Society is a national organization that recognizes students for outstanding academic achievement, leadership, service, and character.  The HCP chapter is active on campus and conducts multiple events and service projects each year.

message.text: Had a great time attending #AAI2024, my first academic conference as a graduate student! I learned so much about the exciting work being done by the #immunology2024 community.
